Use the TradingView Widgets in your Nuxt Application
Use the TradingView Widgets in your Nuxt 3 Application
🍧 No Registration or API for TradingView
🌴 Optional Widget Inclusion (For Reducing Bundle Size)
🍽️ Customizable Component Names with Prefix Option
, but you can also refer to the examples below.
for more information and configuration about the widgets.

# Using yarn
yarn add nuxt-tradingview

# Using npm
npm install nuxt-tradingview

# Using pnpm
pnpm add nuxt-tradingview
That's it! You can now use TradingView Widgets in your Nuxt app ✨

The built-in widgets have default options based on Tradingview. If you did not define any options, the default options will be applied. Check available options on the
Example of using all widgets with default options:
Configuring the widgets with options according to
Or, you can pass a ref variable into it:

<template>
  <Chart :options="chartOptions" />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
const chartOptions = ref({
  theme: 'dark',
  autosize: true,
  symbol: 'NASDAQ:AAPL',
  timezone: 'Etc/UTC',
})
</script>

The module by default will inject
, but you can configure it to inject only the widgets you need. Additionally, you can add a prefix to widget component names to avoid conflicts with other local components.
To change default widget component names, you can add a
section to use every widget with that prefix.

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Generate type stubs
npm run dev:prepare

# Develop with the playground
npm run dev

# Build the playground
npm run dev:build

# Develop the docs
npm run dev:docs

# Run ESLint
npm run lint
